name: Madhuragati: An Odissi Dance Performance
description: Madhuragati - Every step in Odissi resounds with the sweetness of a cultural aesthetic formed over centuries of aspiration for a higher goal.. To celebrate the beauty of this exquisite dance form arising from the life and beliefs of the people of forgone times till now. Anoushka will perform dance works that showcase a range of possibilities highlighting the sculptural and expressive qualities of the Odissi style.The performance features pieces that are seamlessly connected by brief introductory interludes. This carefully crafted format offers an engaging experience for the audience, guiding them through the beauty of the Odissi classical dance form. Originally a sacred ritual dedicated to the gods, Odissi is one of the oldest dance traditions in the world. Odissi speaks of love and union, between the human and divine, transporting viewers to enchanted worlds of magic and spirituality. Its sensuous and lyrical grace reflects both the motifs of Odisha temple sculpture as well as the poetry from the deep wellsprings of Odia music.Anoushka Rahman, disciple of Guru Surupa Sen, is the new soloist and emerging star of The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.She started her Odissi journey with Smt.Dona Ganguly in Kolkata and holds a Sangeet Bhaskar in Odissi dance and a postgraduate degree in Mathematics.Her association with Nrityagram began in 2018 through a Summer Workshop, which paved the way for advanced training under the guidance of Surupa Sen and Pavithra Reddy. Recognised for her talent and dedication, she was awarded the Virendra Kumar Laroia Fellowship. She has performed with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble across India, the US, Canada and Sri Lanka and was presented in a solo debut performance in November 2024. At present, Anoushka is a dancer with The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble.ChoreographyGuru Kelucharan Mohapatra (Sun Maiyyā)Surupa SenMusic CompositionPt. Raghunath PanigrahiAshit Desai (Sun Maiyyā)Technical Director & Lighting DesignerLynne FernandezNrityagramwww.nrityagram.orglynne@nrityagram.orgVenue: SABHA Blr, 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: USIRU Breathing Workshop
description: A transformative 3-hour immersive Neuro-reboot workshop designed to help you recalibrate with your breath, reset dysregulated stress responses, and experience emotional regulation for performance optimisation.Many of us go through life breathing shallowly and unconsciously — leaving our nervous system in a constant state of stress. Usiru Breathwork guides you to re-train your nervous system using breath, scientific, somatic, and meditative tools so you can heal anxiety, calm your mind, and restore inner peace.Under the guidance of Raanika D. Kararia, an experienced breath master and healer, this session integrates breathwork, meditation, energy release, and guided healing techniques to support deep relaxation and enhance resilience and adaptability. We conduct an HRV coherence assessment before and after the breathwork session to measure shifts in autonomic balance. The change in coherence and variability reflects how effectively the practice activates the parasympathetic system. A simple Nervous System Score is also provided to indicate emotional regulation and overall well-being.

name: Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle: Book Launch
description: In an era where Gen Zs and millennials seek meaning through experiences rather than possessions, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle – Stories of Friendships & Adventures in Nature offers exactly the kind of soulful escape today’s young adventurers crave. For those who live for spontaneous road trips, mountain treks, beach escapades, and serendipitous conversations with strangers—and secretly nurture the hope of finding love and companionship along the way—Priyanka Kumar’s latest collection is a deeply relatable read. With its mix of short stories and memoir-style reflections, this book resonates with those who believe that real connection and personal discovery often happen far away from the familiar.The newest installment in Priyanka’s celebrated People’s Kafe series, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle brings together heartfelt stories and travel-infused memories that capture the healing magic of nature and the unspoken bonds we form with people and places. Though it’s not a travelogue in the conventional sense, the book reads like one—with vivid glimpses into landscapes and emotions that stay with the reader long after they turn the final page.And yet, the book is as much about the people as it is about the places. There are tales of peacocks who roamed her childhood garden like kin, strangers-turned-friends on spontaneous journeys, and even encounters that subtly hint at love blossoming when least expected. The presence of love—gentle, unforced, and organic—is a quiet undercurrent in a couple of these stories, offering a warm, relatable thread for every romantic dreamer who has ever looked out of a train window and wondered, what if?

name: Around the World in 8 Ragas
description: Across continents and centuries, humanity has carried one universal companion: Music. From desert caravans tracing ancient trade routes, to sailors navigating uncharted seas, to pilgrims and warriors moving across borders, cultures have exchanged not only goods and beliefs—but also sound. “Around the world in 8 Ragas” is a concert that explores how musical scales, though born in different corners of the globe, reveal a shared human instinct for expression.Follow the journeys of iconic scales—Pentatonic, Raga, Maqam, Modes, and more. We uncover how these musical structures spread through Silk Road markets, African diaspora rhythms, medieval monasteries, and colonial crossroads. We invite audiences to listen to history, one Raga at a time.Performers :Ashwin Baliga, Vocals (US-Based Indian Classical vocalist, student of Mahesh Kale and Pt. Milind Chittal, creator of the world's first Raga Bath)Shadaj Godkhindi, Flute (Acclaimed flutist and student of renowned maestro Pt. Pravin Godkhindi)Amit Kavthekar, Tabla (Multi-Genre collaborator and prodigious disciple of Ustad Allah Rakha and Ustad Zakir Hussain)Vivek Santosh, Keys (Trinity-trained Classical pianist with a Masters in Carnatic Music)

name: Earthlore: The Indigenous Music Band
description: Earthlore Band is a one-of-a-kind musical collective from India that blends indigenous heritage with contemporary soundscapes. Rooted in the traditions of communities such as the Jenu Kuruba and Paniya tribes of Karnataka and Kerala, the band features tribal artists who completed an intensive nine-month fellowship program with professional mentorship, supported by the Tata Trusts.Their music is a powerful expression of ancestral stories, rituals, and a timeless bond with nature — an authentic cultural experience brought to the stage.After a captivating performance in Kochi, Earthlore Band now arrives in Bengaluru.Come experience the magic of tribal music in your city!

name: CARBON II: A Solo Guitar Concert By Konarak Reddy
description: This very special solo guitar concert has been composed and curated by Konarak Reddy, to offer the audience a meditative and transportive experience.Konarak’s compositions for CARBON emerged from wondering about the frequencies of joy and consciousness, the romance of darkness and light. Memories of Isaac Albéniz’ Asturias. Chick Corea’s Spain and Bill Evans’ harmonic explorations in Blue in Green.Perhaps you might remember the lines “We are stardust, we are golden, billion year old carbon…" Or, Craig Santos Perez’s riff on Pablo Neruda’s Sonnet XVII “I love you like this because we'll only survive / in the nitrogen rich compost of our embrace, / so close that your emissions of carbon are mine, / so close that your sea rises with my heat.”Perhaps the darkness of carbon can awaken new mysteries for us."Felt blessed indeed for being privy to this ~ letting Kuki's music & musicality wash over us with such finesse & intricacy ~" - Parveen Sikand"Thank you Kuki for your generosity and magic. The songs were personal, you let us into your process of creation, into your mind and its glorious journeys. Still humming a couple of tunes." - Rajeev Ravindranathan"It was a magical and sublime experience. Love, creativity, and music flowed into the entire space and enveloped us."- Leenatha Reddy

name: Mahabharat Quest: Mythological Walks at Lalbagh
description: ✨ What if the Mahabharat came alive through the trees, rocks, & lake of Lalbagh?We wanted to bring the new away to help you experience the Epic that shapes much of India’s cultural imagination.We’ll explore stories and symbols from the saga associated with specific trees, rocks, lakes, and sculptures in the Garden, tracing how they appear in the narrative tradition across Vyas’ magnum opus (be it BORI Critical Edition, Gita Press & KM Ganguli’s first English translation) and regional works (like Sarala Mahabharata, Pampa Mahabhārata) to folk traditions (like Bhil Bharata) along with exploring backstories in Puranic lore while considering medieval to modern retellings. We will end with a fun group activity that will help you understand the structure of the Epic and how text communicates with us.Whether you’ve joined our flagship walks (🔴 North, 🟢 West, 🔵 Main Gate) or themed walks like 🟣 Ramayan Quest — OR this will be your first time at the Garden (or with the Epic) — there’s something both familiar and new for everyone in this never-done-before 🟠 Mahabharat Quest.What is guaranteed is your relationship with the saga, and the space will change forever!🏙️ Afternoon Walk — 20 Dec (Sat) ⏰ 3–4:30 PM (1.5 hours)🌅 Morning Walk — 21 Dec (Sun) ⏰ 7:30–9 AM (1.5 hours)👣 Slow-paced along a shaded path (~1.5 km) for all (10+ years and above), with plenty of resting spots for immersive storytelling.📝 Limited slots with time-based offers, so book early!ABOUT THE PROJECT:Before & Beyond History is an initiative under Mythematical, Prihistorica & Cosmonomic — curated and hosted by Anupriy Kanti & Rohina Thapar — that offers in-person experiences blending mythology, prehistory, and astronomy.

name: Ramayan Quest: Mythological Walks at Lalbagh
description: ✨ Ever wondered what it feels like to walk through moments of the Ramayan — not just read about it?We wanted to bring the new away to help you experience the Epic that shapes much of India’s cultural imagination.Before & Beyond History invites you to a first-of-its-kind themed storytelling walk through Lalbagh Botanical Gardens, where the trees, rocks, and flowers of Bengaluru’s favourite Garden become mediums to one of the world’s greatest epics.Join your hosts, Anupriy and Rohina, as they guide you through this mythological walk that not only tells but also traces how stories and symbols from the Epic evolved across the Valmīki Sanskrit Ramayan (be it BORI Critical Edition or Gita Press), regional retellings like Tulsidas’ Ramcharitmanas, Kamba Ramavataram, Krittivasi Ramayan, and explores backstories in Puranic lore while considering medieval to modern retellings. We will conclude with a fun group activity that will help you understand how the narrative tradition evolves.Whether you’ve joined our flagship walks (🔴 North, 🟢 West, 🔵 Main Gate) or themed walks like 🟠 Mahabharat Quest — OR this will be your first time at the Garden (or with the Epic) — there’s something both familiar and new for everyone in the 🟣 Ramayan Quest.What is guaranteed is your relationship with the saga, and the space will change forever!🌅 Morning Walk — 20 Dec (Sat) ⏰ 7:30–9 AM (1.5 hours)🏙️ Afternoon Walk — 21 Dec (Sun) ⏰ 3–4:30 PM (1.5 hours)👣 Slow-paced along a shaded path (~1.5 km) for all (10+ years and above), with plenty of resting spots for immersive storytelling.📝 Limited slots with time-based offers, so book early!ABOUT THE PROJECT:Before & Beyond History is an initiative under Mythematical, Prihistorica & Cosmonomic — curated and hosted by Anupriy Kanti & Rohina Thapar — that offers in-person experiences blending mythology, prehistory, and astronomy.

name: Four Voices, One Celebration: Book Launch
description: Join us for a morning of inspiration, healing, and heartfelt storytelling as Inner Healing Oasis Publishing proudly presents the launch of four remarkable books — each offering a unique perspective on growth, resilience, and the human journey.On 20th December 2025, from 11:00 AM to 1:30 PM, the iconic Atta Galatta Bookstore in Bengaluru will host this special gathering — uniting four diverse authors whose words resonate with truth, transformation, and hope.Meet the Authors and Their BooksI’m a Fresher, I’m Confused by Zahed Ali A witty, heartfelt story that captures the struggles and aspirations of a young man stepping out of college and into the fast-paced world of the IT industry. Honest and humorous, it reflects the confusion, courage, and self-discovery of a generation finding its way.Heal with Melody by Shweta Saimy A soulful guide to using sound, rhythm, and vibration as pathways to healing. Through the language of music and emotion, this book helps readers reconnect with inner harmony and find balance through self-expression.Her Second Spring by Dr. Sameer Paranjape A compassionate and empowering book that brings to light the emotional, physical, and social experiences of women navigating menopause. It is a celebration of the strength, wisdom, and renewal that mark a woman’s “second spring” in life.Rewriting Destiny by Sanjib Chowdhury A transformative exploration of quantum healing and human consciousness. Sanjib blends science and spirituality to reveal how we can transcend limiting beliefs and consciously shape our destiny.An Event to Inspire and ConnectThis multi-author launch is more than a literary gathering — it’s a celebration of stories that heal, empower, and ignite conversation. Meet the authors, listen to their journeys, experience live readings, and be part of a morning that celebrates creativity, courage, and community.We are also honored to have industry experts from relevant fields gracing the event with their presence — adding depth, dialogue, and fresh perspectives to the conversation.Come witness the moment where ink meets energy, and stories come alive.Venue: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indiranagar, BengaluruDate: 20th December 2025Time: 11:00 AM – 1:30 PMHosted by: Inner Healing Oasis (IHO)

description: Letters of Connection is a community letter writing circle that was started in 2023 by Svaha Space, a creative arts mental health initiative. This circle's theme is "Thank you and Good-bye 2025". It's an opportunity for you and your friends to come together on a Sunday afternoon and take some space to look back at how much 2025 has brought in, taken out, and put to rest in your life. There will be opportunities to share what your letter endeavour brought up for you or to just witness what others would like to share. We look forward to having you there.

name: My Life Closed Twice: Book Launch
description: Author Subhashini Kaligotla launches her new poetry collection My Life Closed Twice (Copper Coin, 2025), with Jeet Thayil.In My Life Closed Twice, Subhashini Kaligotla charts the long aftermath of grief, and its recursive, obsessive cadences. Drawing on premodern India’s art, literature, and history, through invented forms and received ones, in fragments, litanies, lists, and queries, the poems in this spare volume embody the psychological terrain of the grieving. Two premature deaths are at the heart of the book. Kaligotla writes of their immediate aftereffects and their enduring impact. She braids her voice with voices from India’s past—from the unknown bards of the Sanskrit epics who counsel equanimity in the face of catastrophe to the laments of Ashoka, Bilhana, and Jahangir.Author BioSubhashini Kaligotla is a poet and an art historian of ancient and medieval South Asia. She is author of the poetry collection Bird of the Indian Subcontinent and the monograph Shiva’s Waterfront Temples. She teaches at Columbia, dividing her time between New York City and Hyderabad.Advance Praise for My Life Closed TwiceSubhashini Kaligotla’s ingeniously fashioned poetic structures—which are light, flexible, delicate yet possessed of remarkable tensile strength and architectural clarity and integrity—aren’t just beautiful in themselves. They’re also vessels for deep imaginative feeling and thinking and wondering and longing. She has a unique, compelling lyric voice and a distinguished twenty-first century consciousness.-Vijay SeshadriAnger, denial, bargaining, despair, all the stages of grief except acceptance, each stage overlaid with the forensic precision generated by love when it has nowhere to go. These enraged, laceratingly plainspoken poems burn with the singular self-awareness that is the writer's curse, and the writer's gift. Two deaths enclose the book like 'two dates // enclosed / by parentheses'. It is impossible to read, say, 'Only Your Brother Will You Lose' – its fifty shards hammered into the flesh like fifty nine-inch nails – and come away unscathed. -Jeet Thayil

name: Manasa's Mat Pilates + High Tea
description: Manasa is back! Visiting her hometown of Bangalore from Chicago, we’re thrilled to welcome her to the Studio as she brings her signature high-tempo, form-focused Pilates style to the mat.Pilates with Manasa is a comprehensive movement therapy for the entire body. It meets your body exactly where it is, celebrating all its imperfections while working on posture, spinal health, controlled breathing, and deep muscles that often go unnoticed.It’s strength, mobility, and flexibility all rolled into one.After class, we’ll settle down for a nourishing High Tea, a cozy way to recharge, connect, and savor the moment.Come join us for a rejuvenating session of pilates, wholesome bites, and perhaps meaningful connections.About ManasaManasa is a powerhouse instructor who inspires self-love through every sweat session. She thrives on seeing her clients challenged—and humbled—by the effectiveness of low-impact, mindful workouts. With 4 years of teaching experience and over 400 women coached across all walks of life, she brings both online and offline sessions to life with energy and precision.Her passion extends beyond movement: she’s training to become a trauma-informed instructor and a functional hormone specialist, with a focus on coaching women throughout all stages of life — from pre- and post-natal to menopause.

name: Movie Under the Stars | Notting Hill (1999)
description: Join us for an open-air screening of Notting Hill (1999), the beloved romantic comedy that defined an era of charm and chance encounters, paired with a three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron and fresh popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movie:Notting Hill (1999) follows William Thacker, a quiet London bookseller whose life takes an unexpected turn when he meets Anna Scott, the world’s most famous movie star, in the most ordinary of moments. What unfolds is a tender, funny, and unforgettable love story set against the pastel streets and cosy corners of Notting Hill.With iconic performances by Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts, it remains one of the most timeless rom-coms ever made, gentle, witty, and perfect for a December evening.Paired with a warm, elegant three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron and wines poured by Wine in Progress, it’s the perfect night to settle in, unwind, and let the story sweep you in.

name: Inversion Workshop with Soumya Pathak
description: ⸻Handstand Workshop with Soumya Pathak20th & 21st December | 10:30 AM – 12:30 PMIncludes: Handstand Workshop+Meet & Greet+Breakfast bowl + beverage + goodie bagElevate your practice with a focused handstand workshop led by Soumya Pathak, designed to build strength, balance, and confidence in a way that feels both challenging and deeply rewarding.Across two hours, you’ll learn the foundations of alignment, engagement, and technique — creating a safer, smarter pathway into inversions, whether you’re a beginner or refining your form.After practice, enjoy a light breakfast bowl and a beverage, followed by a curated goodie bag to take home — a little reminder of the work you’ve done and the energy you’re stepping into.This workshop welcomes every level — from first-timers to seasoned practitioners — with thoughtful guidance and supportive variations throughout. Please bring your mat and blocks; we’ll hold the rest of the journey for you. You’re also welcome to stay back for the meet-and-greet after the workshop.

name: Human Library Bengaluru
description: Each chapter of Human Library is a guided space for meaningful, non-judgmental conversations, structured by thoughtful prompts. These prompts allow attendees to explore different perspectives, stories, and memories.Note: This is not a dating event.You can choose to listen to others` stories and share your own when you feel comfortable. Every participant takes turns sharing a memory, opinion, or experience related to the prompt assigned to them.\Structure of the event:1. Introduction of attendees and the host.2. Attendees are divided into smaller groups.3. Each group receives a bowl of prompts.4. Prompts are divided into three levels: Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3.5. Level 1 prompts help people get to know each other.Example: What is your earliest childhood memory?6. Level 2 prompts encourage deeper conversations.Example: What is one habit from your lifestyle that you would recommend to others?7. Once Level 1 and Level 2 conversations are completed, the smaller groups are merged for Level 3 prompts.8. Depending on the number of attendees, either one or two larger groups are formed for Level 3 conversations.Come. Join. Share your stories or listen to others.

name: Shibari Classes For Beginners
description: This is an immersive learning space for people who want to practice Shibari but haven't found the right space, people or facilitator in India to learn from.The goal of these six week courses is to facilitate regular, structured Shibari practice that aims to go deep rather than broad, helping you to develop a really firm grasp of rope bondage fundamentals, build muscle memory, and get to know other participants. The classes will be conducted every Saturday afternoon and will be led by Amiya, Founder of Silly Hands Shibari.The 6-week cohort is limited to a select group of registered participants only. No walk-ins.Each ticket gives you entry for 2 People i.e you + your rope partner. What is Shibari?Shibari is a contemporary form of rope bondage that was originated in Japan in the early 1200-1800's. Later popularized in the 21st century as a pleasure-craft. Shibari, despite its various styles, adheres to a certain aesthetic and exclusively uses ropes as a primary tool to build trust and connect with oneself and others.What to expect?3 hour weekly in-person hands-on lessons100% Vetted ParticipantsJapanese Asanawa (Hemp ropes) for the classFree access to Rope Jams1:1 Technical & Safety guidance throughout the programPost-course integration supportLimited Edition SHS MerchThis is a structured learning space that explores mind–body engagement through rope. The course supports flexibility in awareness, communication, and embodied practice, using rope as a practical and intentional tool. Safety, consent, and consistency remain central to the learning process.We will cover the fundamental knots, frictions, patterns, harnesses, and introduces participants to important skills such as rope handling and tensioning. By the end of the course, participants should understand how to construct a short rope scene that brings together technical and playful elements.Further InformationDates: Every Saturday starting 24th January, 2 pm - 5 pm.Where: The Bangalore Local, Koramangala, Bengaluru.Who can Join :Adults 21+ with no prior experience but plenty interest, LGBTQIA+ solo or with a rope partner.The ticket gives you entry for 2 People i.e you + your rope partner.Participants who sign up solo are encouraged to partner up with another solo-participant to practice the ties on each other. If you don’t want to switch (both tie and be tied), then we would recommend coming with a partner.About the Facilitator: Amiya Bhanushali (she/they) is a queer multidisciplinary artist, contemporary curator and creative strategist. Her work explores art, human connection and design across all disciplines, with a focus on Indian and South Asian narratives. They began to explore Shibari in 2022 as an extension of their art and research into kink-based practices. As their style naturally progressed beyond aesthetics alone, they began to discover interconnections between queerness, pleasure, trauma and neurodivergence.Questions? Email us at sillyhands.shibari@gmail.com

name: PoV (Lecture 24): What the Helix a Genome?
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where lectures meet drinks in a relaxed pub-style setting.We're super stoked to host our first ever genomic lecture! Enough hoo-ha about space; let’s take a deeper look at what all of life on earth is coded by. What is it really, and why does it matter for the rise and survival of life on Earth?It was 1859 when Darwin and Wallace co-described the theory of evolution by natural selection, which turned the then-existing perception of life upside down. Nearly a century later, something else happened: the discovery of the acid of life demystifying how life is coded and how this code gets passed on through generations!In this lecture, Ashwini talks about today's research on genomes – an organism’s entire collection of the DNA and how its evolution drives both long-term and short-term changes to life. All this over a complimentary drink from Kling brewery! 🥂🧠 What to Expect💭 A 45-minute lecture💬 15–20 minutes of Q&A to question, debate, and discuss🍹 A 30-minute mixer to connect with fellow curious minds🍺 One complimentary Kling brewery beer or mocktail with your ticket🥨 À la carte food available throughout the day✨ Conversations and one-on-one with the speaker post-talkEvent Details📅 Sunday, 21st December 2025 | 12 PM – 2 PM📍 Kling Brewery, Church Street, Bangalore👤 About the SpeakerAshwini V Mohan is a postdoctoral researcher at the Biodiversity Genomics lab at the University of Neuchâtel, Switzerland. Born and trained in India until her PhD, she moved to Germany to pursue a PhD with the German Academic Exchange Service’s scholarship.Her research has focused on speciation at different scales—from microevolutionary processes like population divergence to macroevolutionary perspectives on species and trait diversification. While most of her pre-doctoral and doctoral research focused on reptile systems, she pivoted towards comparative genomics with the EU Horizon’s Marie Curie postdoctoral grant. Through this work, she developed novel perspectives to measure genomic rearrangements and later provided an opinion on the putative roles of 3D genome organisation in speciation.How genomes evolve, and how their evolutionary paths influence speciation and trait evolution in organisms, is the big question of her research. More recently, she has been thinking about the role of epigenetic changes to genomes and its effects on genome and organismal evolution. She thoroughly enjoys communicating science to the public and is passionate about good mentorship practices, equity, diversity, and the growth of women in academia.🍻 About Pint of ViewPint of View is inspired by the Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., and we’re bringing this format to India across major cities. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables and you leave with a drink in hand and a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻
